body_html: @t-vi , could you let me ask one more question? When I use the native CTCLoss in pytorch, most of the convergences were the sequence of blanks -- but they still have a very low loss, so they were not trained well. I didn't include blanks when I made the target label sequences. Did I do something wrong?

body: @t-vi , could you let me ask one more question? When I use the native CTCLoss in pytorch, most of the convergences were the sequence of blanks -- but they still have a very low loss, so they were not trained well. I didn't include blanks when I made the target label sequences. Did I do something wrong?
